meanings.definition: A person who disguises their true intentions or feelings
meanings.sent1: The dissembler pretended to be happy when he was actually sad.
meanings.sent2: She realized her friend was a dissembler when he lied about his plans.
meanings.sent3: The dissembler at the party wore a fake smile all night.
meanings.sent4: The fox was a clever dissembler, fooling the other animals with his charm.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the dissembler who always has a hidden agenda.

meanings.definition: To conceal one's true motives or beliefs
meanings.sent1: He tried to dissembler his dislike for the new policy during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She would often dissembler her true emotions to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent3: The magician seemed to dissembler his tricks, but the audience was onto him.
meanings.sent4: The clouds dissembler the sun's rays, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: She would dissembler her pain with a smile, never letting others see her struggle.
